topics.body:
I lost my goddamn patience and just went to accept the local college.

If the results come out between today and the registration day, I'll just not attend the day, even though someone could've received the chance to enter that college instead of me. So technically, I just wasted a spot to join the college for everyone else who didn't get the spot.

Fucking shit, I am a jerk for possibly ruining a person's future just by doing this.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5559917863687219da231800#post_5559917863687219da231800

Besides, we call kung fu "kung fu" so it's basically the same thing. We don't call kung fu "beat everyone with brick-breaking fists".

topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555993156368724197730500#post_555993156368724197730500
Kung Fu is a more abstract term that doesn't really translate well to other languages. (It means something like "Hard work")

Rokushiki is directly translatable without any real issues.

The purpose of translating is to translate. Unless It really is untranslatable. (As in you'd have to use a wall of text in order to even remotely get it across. Not the single sentences that most fan translations use.) Then It's unacceptable. (Shichibukai is more understandable to me. But Seven warlords is serviceable IMO.)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184
